extendedIngredients.name: broccoli
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small head broccoli, trimmed into small florets, stalk discarded

extendedIngredients.name: chicken stock
extendedIngredients.originalString: 700ml vegetable stock or chicken stock (using a cube)

extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 stick of celery or half a small bulb of fennel

extendedIngredients.name: flat leaf parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: small handful of flat-leaf parsley leaves, roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: thyme leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 sprigs of thyme stripped of their leaves or 2 pinches of dried thyme

recipes.title: Gruyère & vegetable soup
recipes.instructions: Wash and trim the leek, cutoff and discard half the greentop, then thinly slice. Peel andchop the carrot and potato intoa small dice. Thinly slice thecelery or fennel into bite-sizesticks and dice the onion. Thevegetables should all be ofroughly the same size.Heat the butter and oil in amedium pan and gently sweatall the vegetables, except thebroccoli, with the thyme leavesfor about 10 minutes, stirringevery now and then untilsoftened, but not coloured.Add the flour to the panand stir for a minute until it allbecomes pasty, then slowlystir in the stock. Bring to theboil, stirring until thick thenadd the milk, season welland reduce to a simmer.Continue to simmer for10 minutes, then add thebroccoli florets and continuecooking for another 5 minutesor until the broccoli is justcooked. When ready to serve,stir in most of the parsley, thenladle the hot soup into fourbowls. Scatter each servingwith the cheese and remainingparsley, for your diners to stirin. The gruyère will melt intostrings, which is all part ofits charm.

steps.step: Wash and trim the leek, cutoff and discard half the greentop, then thinly slice. Peel andchop the carrot and potato intoa small dice. Thinly slice thecelery or fennel into bite-sizesticks and dice the onion. Thevegetables should all be ofroughly the same size.
Heat the butter and oil in amedium pan and gently sweatall the vegetables, except thebroccoli, with the thyme leavesfor about 10 minutes, stirringevery now and then untilsoftened, but not coloured.

Add the flour to the panand stir for a minute until it allbecomes pasty, then slowlystir in the stock. Bring to theboil, stirring until thick thenadd the milk, season welland reduce to a simmer.Continue to simmer for10 minutes, then add thebroccoli florets and continuecooking for another 5 minutesor until the broccoli is justcooked. When ready to serve,stir in most of the parsley, thenladle the hot soup into fourbowls. Scatter each servingwith the cheese and remainingparsley, for your diners to stirin. The gruyère will melt intostrings, which is all part ofits charm.
